node.name: Sudo Privileges
node.rich_text:
Anything when a normal user executing which requires higher privilege , then he needs to "sudo" along with it to get higher privileges, for that he need to enter the password of root.
In this case, if we add sudo with the command “man” , the password is not necessary.
Here it says the student can execute “man” using sudo without entering the password. This is a critical vulnerability

When executing, it is not prompting to enter the password and is directly moving to manual page of ls
In the manual , we can execute scroll down, press ‘q’ to exit, etc.
Instead, if we enter !/bin/bash, then we'll get the root shell since we are executing the man along with sudo privileges
After entering !/bin/bash , press enter to get the root shell.
